greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of e.g.f.: (1-x)/(2-exp(x)).
comment: The number of connected labeled threshold graphs on n vertices. - _Sam Spiro_, Sep 22 2019
Also the number of 2-interval parking functions of size n. - _Sam Spiro_, Sep 24 2019
reference: R. P. Stanley, Enumerative Combinatorics, Cambridge, Vol. 2, 1999; see Problem 5.4(a).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
Jean-Christophe Aval, Adrien Boussicault, Philippe Nadeau, Tree-like Tableaux, Electronic Journal of Combinatorics, 20(4), 2013, #P34.
Venkatesan Guruswami, Enumerative aspects of certain subclasses of perfect graphs, Discrete Math. 205 (1999), 97-117. See Th. 6.3.
Sam Spiro, Counting Threshold Graphs with Eulerian Numbers, arXiv:1909.06518 [math.CO], 2019.
formula: a(n) = c(n) - n*c(n-1) where c() = A000670.
Binomial transform is A005840. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 01 2016
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} binomial(n, k) * a(k), n>1. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 01 2016
E.g.f. A(x) satisfies (1 - x) * A'(x) = A(x) * (x - 2 + 2*A(x)). - _Michael Somos_, Aug 01 2016
maple: a:=series((1-x)/(2-exp(x)), x=0, 101): seq(n!*coeff(a, x, n), n=0..100); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Mar 15 2019
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, n! * polcoeff( (1 - x) / (2 - exp(x + x*O(x^n))), n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Aug 01 2016 */
(MAGMA) m:=25; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Rationals(), m); b:=Coefficients(R!( (1-x)/(2-Exp(x)) )); [Factorial(n-1)*b[n]: n in [1..m]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 15 2019
(Sage) m = 25; T = taylor((1-x)/(2-exp(x)), x, 0, m); [factorial(n)*T.coefficient(x, n) for n in (0..m)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 15 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 15 2000
